intro: Guatteria tenuis, commonly known as the slender guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. It produces berries that are edible and often consumed by various wildlife species. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in shaded understory environments within tropical rainforests.
